scenario:
The report on "Strategic Intelligence: Artificial Intelligence in Financial Services" projects the AI market in the financial services industry to reach $1 trillion by 2030, driven by advancements in machine learning and computing power. The report highlights the leading financial institutions that have adopted AI, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and HSBC, as well as specialist AI vendors providing tailored solutions for the financial sector. 

The report estimates the total AI market will be worth $1 trillion by 2030, up from $103 billion in 2023 at a CAGR of 39%. AI is transforming the financial services sector by enhancing decision-making efficiency and enabling improved data analysis. Banks and insurers are applying AI capabilities in underwriting, investment forecasting, and portfolio optimization, benefiting from data-driven insights that increase accuracy and operational speed.

AI can help financial services companies tackle the challenge of cybersecurity by leveraging machine learning to detect anomalies in customer behavior, which can signal potential security threats. The report identifies the leading AI adopters in the financial services sector, as well as specialist tech vendors in this space. 

Key companies covered in the report include AXA, Accenture, Bank of America, BBVA, and Goldman Sachs, among others. The report provides a comprehensive analysis of the AI market in the financial services industry, including market size and growth forecasts, AI timeline, signals, M&A trends, patent trends, company filing trends, and hiring trends.
